args:
Having infiltrated Emile's manor under the guise
of servants, the heroes find an audition awaiting
them. With Pia and Zodiark on the brink of
disqualification due to a string of failures, they
bet everything on taking out imperial soldiers.
This manor is soooo pretty inside...\nIt's like a grand cathedral!

Hmm... This room is a strangely large one
in which to summon new servants; I fear
there may be more going on here than
we are aware of.
Yet we came here to begin with because of\nstrange happenings, did we not?
Welcome to all of our new recruits. I am\nthe head butler, and it is my responsibility\nto oversee daily operation of this manor.

And on that note, I pray you forgive the
abruptness of the matter, but you will all
now participate in a servants' audition.
READY YOURSELVES! HEAVEN OR HELL!
...I must adapt to servant customs.\nHeaven or hell.
You don't need to adapt to anything!
Yeah! I mean, we already got the jobs,\nright? So what's with all this?
Quite right. As we have already received\nnotice of our appointments to this manor,\nwhy is there any need for an audition?
I understand your concerns—and in truth,\nI had no intention of holding such an\naudition until this very morning.
Sadly, we've received word that certain\nimperial soldiers are seeking to spirit\nEmperor Emile back to the Empire.

I will not permit anyone to interfere with
Emperor Emile. Those who wish to take
him back are no friends of ours, and must
be completely eliminated!

Therefore, I shall conduct an audition to
ensure that none of their number have
managed to infiltrate our location.
THANK YOU FOR UNDERSTANDING!
Well then. It seems we've little choice.
Indeed. Though one thing troubles me.
Are we not the very group seeking to\nspirit Emile away from here?
You bet your buns we are—and if that\nhead butler realizes it, we'll be thrown\nout of this place ON said buns!
Then we simply have to not be found out.\nThis changes nothing. The plan continues.
They are looking for imperial soldiers.\nTherefore, if we simply behave normally,\nthey should be none the wiser.

The pair of you have had the fundamentals
of servant work hammered into you. If you
can demonstrate that, you will have little
to fear from a mere audition.
Now let us prepare for the job ahead.\nWhat say you?

As you know, we are going to conduct an
audition in order to ascertain your skills
and qualifications as members of the
household staff.

We merely need you to prove that you are
honest-to-goodness servants and not a
bunch of vile imperial spies. Thank you
for your understanding in this matter.
Participants are given five points to begin,\nand docked one for each failure.

Should any participant's score reach zero,
they will be disqualified and removed
from the premises posthaste. Impress me,
however, and you will pass.
I wish you all success in the world.\nNow let the first test begin!
The first trial involves one of the core\nfundamentals of a servant's work:\nannouncing tea time.
You will use this set that I have prepared,\nthen employ a bit of your own flair as you\napproach and announce it is time for tea.
(I was expecting some sort of dastardly\ntask, but this is surprisingly simple.)

(Having completed their brief training,
my companions have a path to victory.
But perhaps I ought to lead the way
and set an example.)
I volunteer to go first, sir.
Excellent. Let us see what you can do.
Please forgive the intrusion during your\nwork, milord, but it is nearly time for tea.
Today's brew comes from freshly picked,\nfirst-flush leaves of the spring season,\nand is paired with a seasonal fruitcake.

I know your work keeps you quite busy,
but I pray you take this moment to rest
and experience the colors of the season.
Now please do enjoy.

Outstanding! Perfect usage of the tools
provided AND the careful consideration
to encourage your hard-working lord to
sample the pleasure of the seasons!

You hewed close to the familiar while also
going above and beyond. It was a subtle,
yet masterful performance. Bravo, I say!
You pass with flying colors!
Who the heck is THAT guy?!
You honor me, sir. And with that, I am off.\n(Now you see how to do it, you two.\nJust follow my lead!)
(Yes, I see. One must adhere to the basics\nof expected behavior while incorporating\ntheir own special flair.)
I would be tested next, sir.
Stop working at once and enjoy this\ntea and snack I brought you!
It is dragonfruit tea accompanied by my\npersonal favorite, raw and bloody meat.\nNow eat it!

What cheek! What abject IMPUDENCE!
To think THOSE are the words with which
you would seek to entertain your master—
and such a haughty manner to boot!
Also, the food you offered would likely kill\na normal human. FAIL! You lose one point.
(That I of all people could misread it so!\nIt slipped my mind entirely that humans\nand dragons view things differently.)
(But surely the sweet and honest Pia will\nbe fine. Er...surely?)
Um, I'd like to go next if that's okay?
Very well. Let us move on.
Right! Um, excuse me, sir,\nbut it's almost tea time.
Today's tea has been...um...flushed?\nOh, and we have cake seasons!
I know you're busy and stuff, but maybe\nyou can eat this and enjoy the smell of\nspring...colors? I'd really like it if you did!
(Egads! Her sweetness and honesty\nhave utterly backfired!)
(She took my lead as a signal to imitate\nexactly what I did, which lead her far out\nof her element!)
Despite the caliber of example set for you\nbeforehand, young lady, it will not do to\nsimply attempt its pale imitation.
I wanted to see your own unique\nsensibility and originality, which I most\ncertainly did not. FAIL! You lose one point.
Oh nooooo... That's the kind of thing I hear\nall the time in my singing lessons...
Her failing grade is shaking the very\nfoundation of her identity—I can scarcely\nbelieve they both erred in such a way!
Tidying up around a desk area, is it?\nThis should be a simple matter.
First, I shall dispose of all this junk.\nHAAAAAAAH!
There! The junk has been annihilated\nwithout even a speck of dust left behind.\nSurely this earns me a passing grade?
Oh geez, I have to organize the bookshelf.\nOkay, Pia! You've got this!
I'll put the book he's reading now here\nin front...and then clean the dust in the\nback there...
You came here with me, Mr. Mouse?\nThank you for your help!
GYA! Have you ANY idea how unhygienic\nit is to bring a rodent into this manor?!\nFail! Fail, fail, fail, fail, FAIL!
A number of unfortunate happenings led to a series\nof further failures for Zodiark and Pia.
Their points continued to dwindle, until they each\nfound themselves with but a single one remaining.
Oh, this is terrible! If we lose one more\npoint, we're gonna be thrown out of here\non our poor buns!
The battlefield is already strewn with our\nfellows in failure...

Fail, fail, fail! All those who are now out
of points will be dropped at once!
AND WHEN YOU ALL GET TO HELL,
YOU TELL THEM WHO SENT YOU!
Ahhh! Where does this even go...
A cruel exit indeed. And yet that selfsame\nfate likely awaits me.

I fear I may have critically underestimated
this situation. True, your mistakes were...
unexpected, but this head butler's
inspection is most strict indeed.
We must find a way to turn this situation\naround. Think, both of you!
Give Emperor Emile back to us!
Hmph! Come to steal away my dear\nEmperor Emile, have you? And without\nbothering to schedule an appointment!

We don't need a damn appointment!
You might've stopped Saboa and the
others, but we're not leaving here
without our emperor!

The people of the Empire are at loose
ends with worry! They can't even work!
I don't know if he's in jail or what,
but you're going to let him out NOW!
We are going to drive off the imperials.
I bear them no ill will, but this is our final\nchance to prove we are not spies and pass\nthe head butler's audition.
If we let this chance slip away, there will\nbe no tomorrow—so let us have it done,\nbut done carefully.
Your vigor rather resembles that of a\ncertain head butler I recently met.
Edward's right. We're in a real pickle,\nand this is our only option.
Now let's do it for Emile!
